issue.title: [R] Re-organise cookbook content to reflect user needs
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-13394](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13394). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
We're likely to have distinct groups of users - those who are mainly performing tasks like reading/writing data and using dplyr syntax to query data, and then those who are performing more in-depth data engineering tasks such as ensuring successful interfacing with databases via schemas etc - content should be organised with this in mind

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13394?focusedCommentId=17455076) by Nicola Crane (thisisnic):*
Cookbook work now being tracked on the cookbook GH Issues page: https://github.com/apache/arrow-cookbook/issues
